text: <@U01G3BG7AFR> I am trying to create a column of a data frame which I can effectively use to broadcast scalar values with `@transform` . Currently `@transform d A = 1` does not work.

elements.text: I am trying to create a column of a data frame which I can effectively use to broadcast scalar values with

text:
The multiplicative identity is `one(x)`, and this knows about strings:
```julia> let x = pi
       x * one(x)
       end
3.141592653589793

julia> let x = "pie"
       x * one(x)
       end
"pie"```
But not sure you have access to `x`.

elements.text:
julia> let x = pi
       x * one(x)
       end
3.141592653589793

julia> let x = "pie"
       x * one(x)
       end
"pie"
But not sure you have access to

text:
You can also forgo using the macro `@transform` and just add the column. No need for anything fancy.
`df.A = fill(scalar_i_want, size(df, 1))`

elements.text: You can also forgo using the macro
and just add the column. No need for anything fancy.

text:
<@ULNHYTCJC>

```@transform d A = 1```
absolutely should work. What version of DataFramesMeta are you on? Or DataFrames?

```julia> df = DataFrame(b = [1, 2, 3]);

julia> @transform df A = 1
3×2 DataFrame
 Row │ b      A     
     │ Int64  Int64 
─────┼──────────────
   1 │     1      1
   2 │     2      1
   3 │     3      1```
